intro: Sebastiania glandulosa var. microdendron, commonly known as the dwarf sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers that are often borne in compact inflorescences. It typically grows as a low shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and as a container plant.
